result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aloysius F. Watts

records.addlTxt:
9:51 AM Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Aloysius F. Watts in court, in custody.  Attorney Xavier Solis in court for Aloysius F. Watts. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF414/22CF473.Victim rights compliance. Attorney Solis states the DE received an offer from the State and is requesting an adjournment so he may continue to review all the discovery and to continue to discuss resolution with the State. The State does not object.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Aloysius F. Watts appeared with Attorney Xavier Solis.  Defendant in custody.   Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered by the Court.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Atty Solis is ill today and requests adjournment. DE has previously waived time.  PH 06-16-22 at 10:15 am Intake.  DA notified.

124PM   Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State.   Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Xavier Solis.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 09:45 am.  Bond continued w/ same conditions (see previous bond entry). mi

Defendant Aloysius F. Watts in court, in custody.  Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Deft is eligible for SPD services, however, no atty has agreed to represent this applicant.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *No Weapons especially Firearms.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Alicia M., Todd P. and TIW

01:39 PM  State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Francesco Balistrieri.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.  $25,000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  kmk
and witness list filed by the State
